result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. CASSANDRA SUE MONTONYA

records.addlTxt:
10:31 AM Defendant CASSANDRA SUE MONTONYA appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for CASSANDRA SUE MONTONYA. 
Attorney waives reading of complaints in 22CF575 & 22CF582. 
Defendant is informed of charges. 
Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint. 
Attorney Erdman requests defendant to contact SPD to get appointed on new matters.
Review hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:45 am.

11:27 AM Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant CASSANDRA SUE MONTONYA in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for CASSANDRA SUE MONTONYA. 
Bond continued.
Review hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:22 AM Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant CASSANDRA SUE MONTONYA in court.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless in court for CASSANDRA SUE MONTONYA. 
Request to have file reappointed to same attorney handling out of county matters.
Review hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
2:13 PM Prosecuting attorney Sara Matthews in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant CASSANDRA SUE MONTONYA in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless in court for CASSANDRA SUE MONTONYA. Attorney waives reading of complaint. 
Defendant is informed of charges. 
Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint. Bond continued.
Review hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant shall not possess any syringes unless medically required.
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.
Not to possess or consume any prescription drugs not prescribed.
No contact with co-defendant, Ashlea Heflen. May have one time contact to retrieve belongings. To be arranged through Victim Witness.

Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant CASSANDRA SUE MONTONYA appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless appeared by video for CASSANDRA SUE MONTONYA.
